dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.text: John runs across a grass verge and another car park. He s the taxi rounding the corner and head down the road in fr of him. John runs as fast as he can up this road, but the taxi is getting away. Eventually he gives up, and he drives away.

dialogues.text: John's face at the window. Almost cheek to cheek with Nad

dialogues.text: Oh Jesus.

dialogues.text: Nadia still stands by the window, one hand behind her bac Alexei sits on the bed. The scene is subtitled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. I don't need to tell you  that.

dialogues.text: Nadia looks at the floor.

dialogues.text: I wouldn't leave my child would I?  You know that. I was confused. That's  all.

dialogues.text: John opens the bathroom door a crack. He is at the opposi end of a corridor from the bedroom. He can hear Alexei's  voice. Breathing hard, he tiptoes out and stands in the corridor his back pressed hard against the wall. He takes one step down the hall. The floor creaks loudly.

dialogues.text: It wasn't easy for me. You know what  I'm like. I needed to know what I  wanted. Now I know. It's simple. I'm  happy.

dialogues.text: John takes another step down the hallway. There, by the d are the two guitar cases full of money. Next to them is  Nadia's bag. Crouching, John opens the bag and searches  inside. dialogues.text: You still love me? Eh? Of course you  do. Come here. Yuri won't be here  for a while. Come on babe.

dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What are you doing?

dialogues.text: (to John) What are you doing here?

dialogues.text: Alexei kicks John in the ribs.

dialogues.text: He looks at Nadia, the girl he came back for, angrily poi the knife at him. He suddenly looks completely punctured. John has struggled up again and stands behind him. They a both looking at Nadia.

dialogues.text: What. You're what? You're with this  creep now.

dialogues.text: Leave him!

dialogues.text: You have. You've actually fallen for  this prick.

dialogues.text: Alexei looks dumbstruck. He laughs emptily

dialogues.text: It's not mine either.
